title: geog712package-vignette
text: sf package used handle vector spatial data.
code: library(geog712package) library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.12.1, GDAL 3.8.4, PROJ 9.3.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE

title: geog712package-vignette
text: Load plot grocery_CT vector data. data contains geometry census tracts Hamilton two variables showing population count 2021 grocery store counts census tract.
code: data("grocery_CT") plot(grocery_CT[ ,"POP21"],      main = "2021 Population Count") plot(grocery_CT[ ,"Grocery"],      main = "Grocery Store Count")

what: A simple OLS Multiple regression of these two variables
title: geog712package-vignette
text: Based simple regression (p-value=0.66>0.05), population count helpful predicting count grocery stores Hamilton.
code: lm1 <- lm(Grocery ~ POP21, data = grocery_CT) summary(lm1) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = Grocery ~ POP21, data = grocery_CT) #>  #> Residuals: #>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max  #> -0.6646 -0.5989 -0.5654  0.4079  3.4094  #>  #> Coefficients: #>               Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept)  6.657e-01  1.949e-01   3.415 0.000824 *** #> POP21       -2.082e-05  4.736e-05  -0.440 0.660843     #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 0.9235 on 148 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:  0.001304,   Adjusted R-squared:  -0.005444  #> F-statistic: 0.1933 on 1 and 148 DF,  p-value: 0.6608

title: Authors and Citation
text: Yin Z (2024). geog712package: GEOG 712 Package. R package version 0.1.0, https://zehuiyin.github.io/geog712package/, https://github.com/zehuiyin/geog712package.

title: GEOG 712 Package

title: GEOG 712 Package
text: basic example shows solve common problem: simple multiplier function multiple two values. Load plot grocery_CT vector data. data contains geometry census tracts Hamilton variable showing count grocery stores census tract.

title: Data Source Information — data_source
text: dataframe containing information raw data package

title: Data Source Information — data_source
text: dataframe 3 columns: Name Data Name: name dataset. URL Source (URL): link data downloaded. Date Accessed Date: date data downloaded.

title: Data Source Information — data_source
code: data(data_source) summary(data_source) #>      Name               URL                 Date            #>  Length:4           Length:4           Min.   :2024-10-04   #>  Class :character   Class :character   1st Qu.:2024-10-04   #>  Mode  :character   Mode  :character   Median :2024-10-04   #>                                        Mean   :2024-10-04   #>                                        3rd Qu.:2024-10-04   #>                                        Max.   :2024-10-04   head(data_source) #>                             Name #> 1                grocery.geojson #> 2           fall2024_GTFS_static #> 3 ontario_latest_cropped.osm.pbf #> 4            hamilton_CT.geojson #>                                                               URL       Date #> 1                            https://overpass-turbo.eu/index.html 2024-10-04 #> 2                       https://opendata.hamilton.ca/GTFS-Static/ 2024-10-04 #> 3 https://download.geofabrik.de/north-america/canada/ontario.html 2024-10-04 #> 4                                     https://censusmapper.ca/api 2024-10-04

what: Grocery Stores in Census Tracts in Hamilton — grocery_CT
title: Grocery Stores in Census Tracts in Hamilton — grocery_CT
text: sf dataframe containing information number grocery stores Census Tract Hamilton

title: Grocery Stores in Census Tracts in Hamilton — grocery_CT
text: sf dataframe 4 columns: GEOUID unique ID geographical unit POP21 population count census tract 2021 Canadian Census Grocery number grocery stores census tract geometry Geometry column sf dataframe

title: Grocery Stores in Census Tracts in Hamilton — grocery_CT
code: data(grocery_CT) summary(grocery_CT[,c("GEOUID", "POP21", "Grocery")]) #>     GEOUID              POP21         Grocery                geometry   #>  Length:150         Min.   :  53   Min.   :0.0000   MULTIPOLYGON :150   #>  Class :character   1st Qu.:2849   1st Qu.:0.0000   epsg:4326    :  0   #>  Mode  :character   Median :3549   Median :0.0000   +proj=long...:  0   #>                     Mean   :3796   Mean   :0.5867                       #>                     3rd Qu.:4672   3rd Qu.:1.0000                       #>                     Max.   :8587   Max.   :4.0000                       head(grocery_CT[,c("GEOUID", "POP21", "Grocery")]) #> Simple feature collection with 6 features and 3 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -79.89331 ymin: 43.17916 xmax: -79.80518 ymax: 43.21881 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>       GEOUID POP21 Grocery                       geometry #> 1 5370001.01  2133       2 MULTIPOLYGON (((-79.82606 4... #> 2 5370001.02  5366       1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-79.85379 4... #> 3 5370001.04  6603       0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-79.86939 4... #> 4 5370001.05  5697       1 MULTIPOLYGON (((-79.8892 43... #> 5 5370001.06  5154       0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-79.8504 43... #> 6 5370001.07  3621       0 MULTIPOLYGON (((-79.83722 4...
